window-source.name: w_data
window-source.description: w_data is a Source window. This is where video frames enter the project.

window-model-reader.name: w_reader
window-model-reader.description: w_reader is a Model Reader window. This window reads the ONNX model and passes it to the w_score window. Also, pre-processing steps for the incoming events are specified in this window.

window-score.name: w_score
window-score.description: w_score is a Score window. This window executes the ONNX modelâ€™s code when data passes through the window.

window-python.name: w_postprocess
window-python.description: w_postprocess is a Python window. The Python code in this window converts the model output (tensor format) to more usable formats.
window-python.code:
import esp_utils
with open("@ESP_PROJECT_HOME@/analytics/yolov7/labels.txt") as file: labels = [line.rstrip() for line in file]
letterbox_image_shape = (@MODEL_HEIGHT@, @MODEL_WIDTH@) original_image_shape = (@PUBLISH_HEIGHT@, @PUBLISH_WIDTH@)
def postprocess_event(output): event = {} output = esp_utils.onnx_tensor.tensor_to_np_array(output) event["Object_x"] = [] event["Object_y"] = [] event["Object_width"] = [] event["Object_height"] = [] event["Object_score"] = [] event["Object_labels"] = ""
for object_id, object_attributes in enumerate(output): x1, y1, x2, y2 = object_attributes[1:5].astype(int) x, y, w, h = esp_utils.postprocessing.bbox_letterbox_to_original( (x1, y1, x2 - x1, y2 - y1), letterbox_image_shape, original_image_shape ) label_id = object_attributes[5].astype(int) score = object_attributes[6] label = labels[label_id]
event["Object_x"].append(float(x)) event["Object_y"].append(float(y)) event["Object_width"].append(float(w)) event["Object_height"].append(float(h)) event["Object_score"].append(float(score)) event["Object_labels"] = f"{event['Object_labels']}{label},"
event["Object_labels"] = event["Object_labels"][:-1] # remove last comma event["_nObjects_"] = len(output) return event

window-object-tracker.name: w_object_tracker
window-object-tracker.description: w_object_tracker is an Object Tracker window. This window enables you to track objects over time.

window-counter.name: w_counter
window-counter.description: w_counter is a Counter window. This window provides an indication of the overall performance.

window-custom.name: w_annotate
window-custom.description: Annotate the results of an object detection and/or a keypoint detection model.

input-map.description: Fields related to image and object detection are required. Fields related to keypoints are optional. Object ID (for object tracking) and attributes are also optional.

property.name: image
property.description: Input image (blob)

property.name: label
property.description: Delimited list containing the class of the detected objects (string)

property.name: x
property.description: Top left X-coordinates of the bounding boxes (array(dbl))

property.name: y
property.description: Top left Y-coordinates of the bounding boxes (array(dbl))

property.name: w
property.description: Widths of the bounding boxes (array(dbl))

property.name: h
property.description: Heights of the bounding boxes (array(dbl))

property.name: score
property.description: Confidence scores array (array(dbl))

property.name: object_id
property.description: Tracked object ID, for example from the Object Tracker window (array(i32))

property.name: attribute
property.description: Delimited list containing the attribute(s) of the detected objects (string)

property.name: object_track_count
property.description: Number of tracks per detected object (array(i32))

property.name: object_track_kpts_count
property.description: Number of keypoints per detected object for the track (array(i32))

property.name: object_track_kpts_x
property.description: X-coordinates for the keypoints track (array(dbl))

property.name: object_track_kpts_y
property.description: Y-coordinates for the keypoints track (array(dbl))

property.name: object_track_kpts_score
property.description: Confidence scores for the keypoints track (array(dbl))

property.name: object_track_kpts_label_id
property.description: Label IDs for the keypoints track (array(i32))

output-map.description: Add an output field, of type `blob`, to store the annotated image. If you use the same image as used in the input variables, the original image is overwritten with an annotated image.

property.name: annotated_image
property.description: Annotated image (blob)

initialization.description: Set the options for the custom window. Note that either `png` or `jpg` is needed as the value for `output_image_encoding` to display images in Grafana.

property.name: input_image_encoding
property.description: Input image encoding - must be one of the following: `wide`, `jpg`, `png`

property.name: output_image_encoding
property.description: Output image encoding - must be one of the following: `wide`, `jpg`, `png`

property.name: object_label_separator
property.description: Object label separator

property.name: kpts_labels
property.description: Keypoint labels
